comment.body: so no, I don't think it's fine.

@Binero I think we see things from a very different perspective, but it's fine (at least, for me:) ). so first of all, thanks for the answer I really appreciate. 

AFAIK inflation rate correlates with the rate of printing more money, so keeping inflation rate means that we don't print Euro more faster (but it doesn't mean we stop doing so, so there's no upper limit just because 'dont do it faster'). What's wrong this my logic, or what should I read / watch to understand ?

@Binero: Thanks, that makes sense. 
" If you cannot trust them, the problem isn't with the currency but with how they are elected." <- especially this one :)
